0.summary:
Category: Practical Guidance (e.g. How-To Advice, Tutoring or Teaching the User, Creative Ideation, Health, Fitness, Beauty, or Self-Care)
Intent: Asking (Seeking information or advice for the user to be better informed on something. The user is asking for information, but the output of the model should serve to inform the user, not to be directly used for a task.)
train_prompts: There are so many novice programs (e.g., Starting Strength, StrongLifts, full-body circuits). How should a beginner decide between them? What criteria—like equipment access, learning curve, recovery demands, and personal goals—matter most?

I’m giving a 10-minute presentation to about 60 people next Tuesday. I usually get a tight chest and shaky hands right before I start. What are a few quick, practical ways to calm my nerves in the 30 minutes leading up to the talk and the final minute before I go on?
I'm a freelancer with lumpy income (some months $6k, some $2k). What's a simple way to start a budget that can handle the ups and downs? Which method tends to work best for irregular income?
I’m overwhelmed by online security advice. What are the top basic steps that give the biggest protection for my accounts and privacy, explained in plain language?

New to budgeting. I take home about $3,200/month. Fixed bills: $1,100 rent, $250 student loan, $220 car payment, ~$150 utilities/phone. I want to build a $1,000 emergency fund and still have some fun money. Should I try 50/30/20 or a zero-based budget to start, and what are the first steps?
I keep waking up around 3–4 a.m. and struggle to fall back asleep. What specific habits should I adjust during the day and evening to prevent this?
What simple monthly checks can I do myself to keep my car reliable and avoid expensive repairs, without needing special tools?
What are the most common beginner mistakes with meal prep, and what's the best way to avoid them?
What’s a simple way to test a few beginner meditation styles this week and decide which one fits me without getting overwhelmed? A short comparison plus a decision tip would help.

I’m new to running and plan to do 3–4 miles on roads a few times a week. I have mildly flat feet and weigh about 200 lbs. Which features should I prioritize—cushioning, stability, heel-to-toe drop, width—and what can I mostly ignore as a beginner?
I live in a humid climate and work out daily. How should I set up a minimalist routine for oily skin so I don’t over-strip my face, and how often should I exfoliate?
Why does stage fright happen, and which simple, evidence-backed techniques (like breathing or visualization) actually reduce anxiety right before speaking?
My 13-year-old panics when we take the phone at night. What are some evidence-based boundaries and a couple of phrases I can use to set them calmly and consistently?
What should a balanced plate look like at a glance? Please explain the usual ratios for vegetables, protein, and carbs, and include simple hand-size cues for portions.
As a beginner, how can I tell the difference between normal muscle soreness and pain that signals I'm about to injure myself while lifting? What should I do in the moment if I feel the latter?
If I only do three things this week to lock down my online accounts, what should they be and why?
For two-factor authentication, should I use SMS, an authenticator app, or a hardware key? Give me simple pros/cons and when each makes sense for a regular user.
I'm visiting a shelter this weekend. What are the most important questions to ask about a dog or cat's history and health, and what red flags should I look for during the meet-and-greet?

I just set up a small home gym with a pair of adjustable dumbbells (5–50 lb), an adjustable bench, and a yoga mat. What basic safety precautions should I take when training alone so I don't injure myself?
First pair of running shoes: how should they fit, and what specific features should I look for when trying them on in-store? Are there any quick tests to tell if a shoe is right for me?

My partner and I split rent and groceries but keep separate finances otherwise. We're trying to start a basic budget without a lot of spreadsheets. What budgeting method would fit, and how should we set it up?
I’m trying to keep my energy steady and avoid blood-sugar spikes. What makes a ‘balanced’ between-meal snack for this goal, and could you give three simple example pairings?
I always dread the Q&A. What can I do just before the Q&A begins to keep nerves from making my mind go blank when the first question hits?
What are some renter-friendly, multipurpose furniture ideas and layout tweaks that make a tiny living room feel organized and not crowded? I already have a small sofa and a foldable dining table.
How do caffeine intake, exercise timing, and screen use before bed affect sleep quality, and what habits should I adopt around each?
I have a 20-minute commute each way and short lunch breaks. Any simple habits I can use during those windows to keep stress from building up?
Before I start meal prep, what food-safety rules matter most (cooling, reheating, fridge vs. freezer storage) to keep meals safe for a few days?
I’m a college sophomore in fast-paced calculus and history lectures. I lose the thread if I try to transcribe everything. Which note-taking method should I use, and why?
What’s an effective note-taking approach for reading dense research papers and textbooks so I capture key claims, evidence, and my questions without over-highlighting?
I switch between a laptop at work and a notebook in class. When is digital note-taking better versus paper, and which note-taking method pairs well with each?
Can you compare the Cornell, outline, and mind map methods for note-taking, and explain when each is most useful?
Can you suggest a basic weekly tidy routine for a small one-bedroom so it stays uncluttered without spending more than 20 minutes a day? I work from home and tend to pile papers on the table.
I'm planning a 4-day solo trip to Lisbon in spring. What should I consider about neighborhoods, lodging types, and getting around to keep it easy and safe?
What low-key body language and quick breathing techniques can help an introvert reduce anxiety during networking without drawing attention?

I overspend on eating out and subscriptions. Could you briefly compare cash envelopes, digital envelopes, and the 50/30/20 rule, and suggest which one might fit me as a beginner? How would I kick it off this week?

For vocabulary in French, is it better to focus on spaced-repetition flashcards or on reading/listening immersion? Which approach leads to better retention for a busy learner, and how would you combine them?

I live in a 300 sq ft studio with no closets. What are simple, low-cost ways to keep it organized? Please focus on storage ideas that don’t require drilling or permanent changes. I have lots of books and kitchen gadgets.

I want to keep my first-place purchases minimal. For a small one-bedroom in a rainy climate, can you give a simple must-have vs. nice-to-have later hierarchy for basics like cleaning supplies, linens, lighting, and safety items?
I'm torn between adopting a dog or a cat as my first pet. What lifestyle factors should I consider to choose the better fit for me?
Any quick dos and don'ts for a Zoom interview? I want to avoid the most common remote-interview mistakes.
I'm new to meal prepping—what core basics should I know before I start, like how to portion meals, what containers to buy, and how long different foods keep?
As a lacto-ovo vegetarian, what does a balanced plate look like, and how big should my protein portion be when using eggs, tofu, beans, or Greek yogurt?
On food labels the serving size confuses me. How does that relate to the portion I should actually put on my plate, and what are a few easy ways to estimate portions without a scale?
Can you explain the difference between an oil change, a tire rotation, and a wheel alignment for someone new to cars—why each matters and how I’ll know it’s time to do them?
I can’t tell if my skin is oily, dry, or combination. How can I figure out my skin type at home, and what would a simple morning and night routine look like once I know?

My budget is $80–$120 for beginner running shoes. Which specs matter most at this price point (e.g., cushioning type, stack height, heel-to-toe drop, outsole rubber, upper material), and which ones are less important?
As a new driver, which dashboard warning lights are maintenance-related (like oil, TPMS, battery) versus urgent stop-now issues, and how should I respond to each in simple terms?
What common beginner mistakes cause most weightlifting injuries, and what simple habits can prevent them?
I always get hungry around 3 p.m. at work. What should I look for on a snack label to stay satisfied until dinner—rough target ranges for calories, protein, fiber, and added sugar?
My weekdays are packed with back-to-back meetings and emails. What are a few quick, science-backed ways to lower stress during the day that I can do at my desk in under five minutes?

I’m brand new to the gym (32, desk job, mild knee discomfort on stairs) and can go 3 days a week. What key factors should I consider when choosing a beginner routine, and what are common red flags that a program isn’t beginner-friendly?
I need pet-safe starter houseplants for a bright living room. Can you suggest a few and outline their basic care needs?
What are some simple rules of thumb for setting a realistic budget for a first solo trip—including flights, accommodation, food, and activities—so I don’t overspend?
I'm interviewing for a software engineering role next week. What are the most common interview mistakes engineers make, and what best practices should I follow to stand out?
What are realistic screen time guidelines for a 7-year-old on school nights vs weekends? We’re trying to cut down arguments and protect sleep.
I'm starting to learn Japanese from scratch while working full-time. What are the most effective habits or routines I can adopt to make steady progress and not quit after a few weeks?
I’ll be running on a mix of paved paths and light trails with no injury history. Do I need separate shoes, or what key features should a beginner look for to handle both surfaces well?

First apartment with a roommate: the living room is mostly furnished, but my bedroom is empty and the kitchen is bare-bones. What essentials do I need right away to function day-to-day, and what items are okay to hold off on?
Can you give me realistic upfront and monthly cost ranges for adopting a dog versus a cat (food, vet care, supplies, insurance) so I can budget?
At conferences, I tend to shut down after the first few minutes of small talk. Can you suggest one or two natural conversation openers and a graceful exit line that suit an introvert?
I live in a 500 sq ft apartment, work 9–6 on weekdays, and have mild dander allergies. Would a cat or small dog be more suitable, and what routines or products would help?
I cook for one and have a small fridge plus about two hours on Sundays. What should I consider before trying meal prep so I don't waste food or end up with soggy meals?
I have about 10 minutes before bed. Which starter meditation would you recommend for better sleep—mindfulness, loving-kindness, or yoga nidra—and why?

Here’s what I’m using now: CeraVe Hydrating Cleanser, The Ordinary Niacinamide 10% serum, and La Roche-Posay Anthelios SPF 50. My T-zone gets shiny by noon but my cheeks feel a bit tight. Does that sound like combination skin, and how should I slot these products AM/PM for a simple routine?
Can you suggest a simple, age-appropriate media plan for our two kids (4 and 11) that covers daily limits, device-free zones (like dinner/bedrooms), and what kinds of apps/videos are okay?

I’m moving into my first unfurnished studio next month with about $300 for initial setup. I already have a mattress and a laptop, and I don’t have a car. What should I prioritize buying in the first week, and what can wait a month or two?
When deadlines pile up I get tight shoulders and shallow breathing. Can you suggest easy, practical techniques I can use between tasks to reset without losing momentum?
Working from home with nonstop Zoom calls leaves me wired at night. What are straightforward wind-down rituals after work that actually help me switch off?

I'm a complete beginner starting weight training at my gym next week. What are the top safety tips I should follow to avoid getting hurt, especially around warm-ups, picking weights, and how fast to progress?
I'm trying to lose a little weight without tracking calories. How would you adjust portion sizes on a balanced dinner plate to help with that?
What do pediatric groups recommend for screen time for toddlers under 2 and preschoolers, and are exceptions like video chatting with grandparents or long flights reasonable?
Which houseplants are best for people who forget to water? Please note the kind of light they like and a simple watering guideline.
I'm switching from teaching to corporate training. What interview missteps should career-switchers avoid, and what are best practices for presenting transferable skills?
For a true beginner, how should I think about the balance between cardio and resistance training in a starter gym plan? What signs tell me the routine is challenging enough but still safe?
I’m nervous about loneliness and staying safe when traveling alone. What mindset shifts and practical habits help first-time solo travelers feel confident and make connections without taking risks?
What are the most effective daily habits to improve sleep quality for a typical adult? Please keep the tips practical.
If I’m choosing between a handful of nuts, Greek yogurt, or a protein bar, which is likely to keep me fuller longer in a healthy way, and why?
I work rotating shifts. Which sleep hygiene habits make the biggest difference when my bedtime changes each week?
I’m brand new to houseplants. What are 3–4 super easy indoor plants to start with, and what basic light and watering do each of them need?
I’m new to meditation—what are the most beginner-friendly styles and how do I choose between them if my goals are stress relief versus improving focus?
val_prompts: I’m a first-time car owner with a 2016 Toyota Corolla at about 85,000 miles. Over the next year, what routine maintenance should I plan for, and roughly how often do those items come up?
I tend to lose motivation after a month. What are practical ways to set goals and track progress in a new language so that I stay accountable without burning out?
I get restless and a bit anxious when I sit still. For a beginner, would breath awareness, body scan, or walking meditation be a better fit, and how many minutes should I start with?
I’m moving into a micro-apartment with a cat. What are a few space-saving organization tips that also hide litter box supplies and keep surfaces clear?
I’m going to a tech meetup tomorrow where I won’t know anyone. How should I structure my time (arrival, breaks, simple goals) so I don’t get overwhelmed?
My apartment is low-light with one east-facing window, and I travel for two weeks at a time. Which beginner-friendly indoor plants could handle that, and what simple care should I plan for?

From a nutrition standpoint, what actually makes a snack both healthy and filling between meals? Explain the key components (protein, fiber, healthy fats, and volume/water) and how to combine them without overdoing calories.
I’m an introvert who dreads crowded mixers. What are a few practical strategies to make a 90-minute industry happy hour feel manageable while still meeting 2–3 people?
I often use public Wi‑Fi at coffee shops. What quick precautions should I take to keep my logins and browsing private?

I cook most nights. For a small kitchen, which items are true essentials to buy first (e.g., a basic pot/pan set, knife, cutting board) and which appliances (microwave, air fryer, toaster, coffee maker) can I skip or wait on?
I tend to catastrophize that I’ll forget my lines as I’m being introduced. Can you suggest a short pre-talk routine to steady my voice and keep my mind clear without taking more than five minutes?
How do I choose a destination for my first solo trip? What criteria matter most (safety, language, transit, cost), and how would you weigh them?
Behavioral questions trip me up. How should I structure my answers effectively, and what common pitfalls should I avoid?

If I have about 45 minutes per session and mostly machine access at my gym, what should I look for in a beginner routine? Also, what simple benchmarks indicate when to adjust the plan over the first 8–12 weeks?
Could you sketch a simple 30-minute daily plan to improve my Spanish (A1 level) that balances listening, speaking, reading, and vocab, and is easy to stick to long-term?
My skin is sensitive, gets red easily, and I get occasional breakouts. What’s a basic, budget-friendly routine (cleanser, moisturizer, sunscreen) and which ingredients should I avoid or look for?

4.summary:
Category: Seeking Information (e.g. Specific Info, Purchasable Products, Cooking and Recipes)
Intent: Doing (Requesting ChatGPT to perform a task, generating output that is directly used for a task.)
train_prompts: For my parents’ 1‑bedroom apartment (about 600 sq ft) with 100 Mbps internet: they want easy app setup, WPA3, and at least two Gigabit LAN ports. Give three dependable routers with brief specs and a one‑line reason each would fit.
Briefly compare Google Drive, Dropbox, and OneDrive for personal use, focusing on storage value, sharing simplicity, and cross‑platform support.
I have a 2x4 ft balcony, can’t drill into walls, and I’m on about a $50 budget. What’s the minimal set of steps and supplies to start a small container herb garden?
New Sony Bravia with Google TV—could you outline concise steps to pair the remote, finish the initial setup, sign into Google, and install Apple TV and Paramount+?
Between Canon and Sony beginner mirrorless bodies for travel, what two specific models would you recommend, and why? I care most about ease of use and battery life.
Can you quickly outline the steps to renew my U.S. passport in person at a post office and list the documents I should bring if my old passport is damaged?
Recommend three new (not refurbished) smartphones under $300 available in the US right now. Please include quick pros and cons for each, prioritizing battery life and camera quality.
Can you give me an easy banana bread recipe with exact ingredient amounts and step-by-step directions? I have 3 very ripe bananas and a 9x5-inch loaf pan.
I'm a U.S. citizen with an adult passport that expired last month. What are the basic steps to renew by mail and what documents do I need to include?
Make me a quick used-car inspection checklist I can use during a test drive—just the essentials a beginner can verify without tools.
I need three make-ahead vegetarian lunches that are high in protein and nut-free. Could you provide the ingredient lists and a one-sentence prep note for each?
Can you make a basic grocery list for five simple lunches for two adults this week? Keep it budget-friendly and minimal prep. Assume I already have salt, pepper, and olive oil.
I have a Cuisinart DCC-3200 drip coffee maker. What’s the safe step-by-step way to descale it at home, including using its Clean cycle if that’s recommended?

Can you give me a one-pot vegetarian dinner recipe that uses common pantry staples (canned beans, rice, onions, garlic, spices) with clear step-by-step instructions? I’ve got 30 minutes and want 3–4 servings.
As a U.S. subscriber, between ESPN+ and DAZN, which offers better live boxing/MMA coverage, and how do their monthly prices stack up? Keep it concise.

My knees get sore with deep squats and lunges. Could you outline a knee-friendly 20-minute beginner bodyweight workout that still trains legs and core, with brief form cues and a short warm-up/cooldown?

Recommend three reliable Wi‑Fi routers for a 650 sq ft apartment on a 300 Mbps plan. Please keep it to three models with brief key specs (Wi‑Fi standard, bands, max link rate, coverage, LAN ports, typical price). Budget around $150, WPA3 required.
Can you recommend three ergonomic office chairs under $400 for a home office, and briefly explain the key features I should look for when comparing options?
In the U.S., can you briefly compare YouTube TV vs Hulu + Live TV for watching live NFL and college football—what key live games/channels they include and the current monthly price?
I'm heading to Japan next month and need a beginner-friendly mirrorless camera that’s compact for travel and decent in low light. Suggest two models and their key strengths.
For a 2018 Nissan Leaf, what should I specifically check before buying a used one? Please provide a short checklist covering battery health, charging, and common wear points.
For a 10x12 bedroom with mild allergies, suggest three affordable purifiers (ideally under $100) and give a quick explanation of HEPA ratings and CADR numbers.
I’ve got two hours to clean a one-bed/one-bath before turning in keys. Can you outline a quick, logical-order checklist that gets the biggest impact fast?
Budget is $400 max. Name three ergonomic office chairs I can buy in the U.S., and tell me which features matter most for all-day comfort.
I wear glasses and take the bus to work. Can you suggest three comfortable, portable noise‑cancelling headphones and list the main pros and cons of each?

In plain terms, how do Google Drive, Dropbox, and OneDrive stack up for an individual regarding privacy/security, offline sync reliability, and how smoothly they work on Windows, Mac, iOS, and Android?
I'm moving out of a one-bedroom apartment this weekend. Can you give me a concise, room-by-room cleaning checklist (about 10–15 items) that should satisfy a typical landlord inspection?
For a U.S. viewer, can you quickly compare Peacock and Paramount+ for live soccer (Premier League vs Serie A) and say what each costs per month?

I'm new to exercise. Can you outline a 20-minute, no-equipment, beginner bodyweight workout I can do at home? Include a 3-minute warm-up, a simple full-body circuit with beginner reps or times, and a 2-minute cooldown.
Can you give me a concise checklist of must-have gear for a weekend hiking trip in mild weather? Assume groomed trails, no rain in the forecast, and I'm staying in a cabin with bunks.
Can you give me a concise guide on how to properly freeze and safely thaw chicken, bread, and homemade soup? I'm short on freezer space, so packaging tips and thawing times would help.

I’m setting up a TCL Roku TV in a dorm that uses a captive-portal Wi‑Fi (web login). Can you outline brief steps to complete setup, get it online with the captive portal, and install Hulu and Spotify?
Please give me a concise checklist for renewing my 10-year U.S. passport from abroad—what are the steps and required paperwork?
What do I need to renew a U.S. passport after changing my name due to marriage, and how should I submit the application?
How can I check whether my Android photos are already backing up to Google Drive, and what should I do if the backup keeps saying “Waiting for Wi‑Fi”?
I'm a beginner planning a mild-weather weekend backpacking loop. Could you list the critical items to bring and mention a few easy-to-forget things like blister care or a headlamp?
What’s the difference between loratadine, fexofenadine, and cetirizine in terms of drowsiness and typical use, including when people generally take them during allergy season?
I need a grocery list to cover 5 vegetarian lunches for two people. No reheating—think sandwiches, salads, and wraps. Please include approximate quantities.
My balcony faces east and only gets morning sun. I want to grow basil, chives, and mint in pots. What are the step-by-step setup instructions and the basic supplies I should buy?
What should be on a minimal yet thorough move-out cleaning checklist for a one-bedroom where I had a cat? Please focus on landlord hot spots that could threaten my deposit.
Suggest three gluten-free, Mediterranean-style vegetarian lunches that keep well for 3–4 days. Just name each dish and list the key ingredients.
I'm in India and my budget is about ₹25,000 (~$300). I need 5G and at least 128GB storage. Which three models would you recommend with key pros and cons?
What’s a quick banana bread recipe I can make tonight? Include ingredient quantities, oven temp, bake time, and the steps.
I have boneless skinless chicken thighs, white rice, garlic, a lemon, and frozen peas. Suggest a simple 30-minute dinner using these; include a short ingredients list and numbered steps.
Can you list some common non-drowsy allergy medicines (both brand and generic) and briefly note what symptoms or situations each is usually used for?
I get seasonal pollen allergies but need to stay sharp at work. What over-the-counter non-drowsy options should I consider, and when do people typically take them (daily vs as needed)?
I'm heading out for a 2-day, 1-night hike in mild spring weather (highs around 70°F/21°C, lows around 50°F/10°C), tent camping. Can you list the essential items I should pack, keeping it lightweight?
I’m new to baking. Could you share a simple, one-bowl banana bread recipe with measurements in grams and Celsius, and clear steps?
Please suggest an easy one-pot, dairy-free vegetarian meal using chickpeas, coconut milk, curry powder, and rice from my pantry, with concise cooking steps.
For commuting, which three over‑ear ANC headphones would you suggest that have strong noise cancellation and clear call quality? Please include quick pros and cons.
I’m in USDA zone 7b with a fairly windy balcony. For herbs, should I start from seeds or buy starter plants? Please outline the starting steps and a basic shopping list.
I batch-cook on Sundays. What's the safest way to freeze and then thaw chicken, a loaf of sourdough bread, and a pot of chicken noodle soup so the texture stays good?
I prefer compact phones (around 6.2 inches or smaller) with NFC and decent performance, under $300 and unlocked for US carriers. Give me three picks with their main pros and cons.
What's an easy one-pan chicken and rice recipe I can make in about half an hour? Please keep the steps concise and beginner-friendly.
I just unboxed a Samsung TU7000 smart TV. Can you give me a short step-by-step to do the initial setup, connect to Wi‑Fi, run a system update, and install Netflix and YouTube?
Small studio, lots of neighboring networks. Budget under $120. I need stable 4K streaming and 15–20 smart‑home devices. Suggest 3 good single‑unit routers (no mesh) and list concise key specs.
Can you give me a quick 30-minute chicken and rice dinner recipe with no more than 6 ingredients and clear step-by-step instructions?
Can you give me a 20-minute beginner bodyweight session I can do at a park with just a bench? Please list the exercises and how long/reps for each, plus one quick progression tip for next week.
Provide a weeknight chicken-and-rice meal I can cook in 30 minutes on the stovetop, with portions for 2, rough cook times, and straightforward steps.
Give me a simple, safe step-by-step checklist to descale a drip coffee maker, and mention common mistakes to avoid (like products not to use or parts that shouldn’t get wet).
Can you recommend three affordable air purifiers for a small bedroom (about 120 sq ft, budget under $120) and briefly explain what HEPA and CADR mean?
In the U.S., can you briefly compare Apple TV’s MLS Season Pass vs Paramount+ for live soccer coverage and price for the upcoming season?
First-timer here: How should I wrap and label chicken, bread, and soup for the freezer, and what's the best method to thaw each one quickly but safely?
I’m choosing between Wi‑Fi 6 and 6E for a 700 sq ft place with 500 Mbps service. Can you recommend three reliable routers and include short specs (Wi‑Fi version, bands, top speed, coverage, price)?

Can you give me simple step-by-step instructions to turn on automatic backup of photos from my Android phone to Google Drive? I have both Google Drive and Google Photos installed. Please include how to make it back up only on Wi‑Fi.
I’ve got a single pot and these staples: quinoa, black beans, corn, salsa, vegetable broth, and spices. Can you outline a quick one-pot dinner recipe with step-by-step directions?

I'm picking a cloud service for my family. Can you give a concise contrast of Google Drive, Dropbox, and OneDrive for personal use, especially the free tiers, photo backup, and collaboration features?
If my main needs are file backup and sharing folders with friends, which would you recommend among Google Drive, Dropbox, or OneDrive, and why? Keep the comparison practical and brief.

Using mostly these items I already have—canned chickpeas, quinoa, cherry tomatoes, cucumbers, baby spinach, tortillas, feta, Greek yogurt, brown rice—suggest three packable vegetarian lunches I can prep in advance. Please add any 1–2 extra ingredients if needed and list the ingredients for each idea.
I have an LG C3 OLED (webOS 23). Please give me a quick setup checklist: first-time setup, Wi‑Fi connection, turning on eARC for my soundbar, and installing Prime Video and Plex.
I'm shopping for my mom. She wants Android, a simple UI, reliable call quality, and good battery life, all under $300. Can you suggest three phones with brief pros and cons?
I'm checking out a 2015 Honda Civic with 95,000 miles from a private seller this weekend. Could you give me a concise, practical checklist of what to inspect in person before making an offer?
I use an iPhone and need compact ANC earbuds for daily train rides. Recommend three options and note key pros and cons (comfort, battery life, noise reduction).
I need a quiet, low-impact 20-minute bodyweight routine for an upstairs apartment (no jumping). Please give me a simple interval structure (work/rest) and 5 or fewer moves that hit the whole body.
For a teen with daytime allergies, could you name a few non-drowsy choices—including pills, nasal sprays, and eye drops—and say when each is commonly used?
Create a simple grocery list for five easy lunches for two with these constraints: dairy-free and peanut-free, about 20 minutes of prep max.
Office-friendly request: give me a concise grocery list to make five different lunches for two people using only a fridge and microwave. Keep it straightforward.
I prefer a mesh back and adjustable lumbar support. Within a $400 budget, what three ergonomic office chairs should I consider, and what features should I prioritize?
Looking for a basic banana bread without nuts: please list the ingredients with amounts and the baking steps for one standard loaf.
I'm new to photography and want a lightweight mirrorless camera for travel under $1000 including a kit lens. Can you recommend two options and briefly explain what each is best at?
val_prompts: Please give me three vegetarian lunch meal-prep ideas I can make ahead on Sunday for the workweek. For each, list the main ingredients only (no steps). Prefer options that can be eaten cold.
I need three budget-friendly bedroom air purifier picks that are quiet for sleep; please include the model names and give a short, plain-English explanation of HEPA and CADR.
I commute on the subway and want three noise‑cancelling headphones under $300. Can you recommend options with brief pros and cons for each?
What are the core essentials to pack for a Saturday–Sunday day-hike combo in mild conditions (no overnight camping), including water, clothing, and safety basics? Short list, please.
I live in a hard-water area and haven’t descaled my Mr. Coffee 12-cup in about a year. What’s the quickest safe method to descale it now, and how often should I repeat it going forward?
What are three low-cost air purifiers suitable for a bedroom with a CADR of at least 100 CFM? Also explain, in a couple of sentences, what HEPA and CADR are.
I don’t want to use Google Photos—just the Google Drive app. What’s the easiest way to upload my Android camera photos to Google Drive and keep them organized by month?
My mom’s Android phone is almost full. Can you outline beginner-friendly steps to back up all her photos to Google Drive and then safely free up space on the phone afterward?
I'm 5'2" with a small frame; with up to $400 to spend, suggest three ergonomic office chairs that would suit me, and note the must-have adjustability features to check.
I want a mirrorless camera for travel that can do solid 4K video and good photos for a beginner. Which two models should I consider, and what are their main advantages on the road?
I only have a microwave, fridge, and a small chest freezer. Could you explain the best practices for freezing and thawing raw chicken, sliced bread, and blended vegetable soup?
I'm shopping in a rust-prone area (Michigan). Can you list the key items to inspect on a used car related to corrosion, brakes, suspension, and paperwork? Keep it brief.
I'm a beginner and want to grow a small herb garden on my apartment balcony. Can you outline the basic steps to get started and a simple list of essential supplies?

Can you walk me through, step by step, how to safely descale a standard drip coffee maker? Please include the vinegar-to-water ratio (and a commercial descaler option), how long to let it sit, and how many rinse cycles to run.
I’m low on fresh produce. Using only pantry items like pasta, canned tomatoes, lentils, olive oil, and dried herbs, what’s a simple one-pot dinner I can make? Please include the steps.

Create a prioritized move-out cleaning checklist for a small one-bedroom with a balcony and a carpeted bedroom. I only have basic supplies (all-purpose cleaner, microfiber cloths, vacuum, mop). Keep it short and actionable.

8.summary:
Category: Self-Expression (e.g. Greetings and Chitchat, Relationships and Personal Reflection, Games and Role Play)
Intent: Expressing (Expressing statements are neither asking for information, nor for the chatbot to perform a task, but simply expressing a user's thoughts, feelings, or opinions.)
train_prompts: Six months into this move and, out of nowhere, the homesickness sucker-punched me. I miss my old bus route, my friends’ dumb jokes, even the creaky floors.

Not looking for advice—just sharing a bright spot. It’s been a rough week, but some tiny wins made me grin: the barista drew a smiley face on my cup, a stranger and I shared an umbrella at the crosswalk, and I caught a loaf of bread still warm at the bakery. Feeling surprisingly buoyed by it all.
Confession: I reorganized my entire room, made a perfect to-do list, even color-coded my calendar—everything except the actual work. I feel silly and ashamed.
I keep opening a blank doc and staring at it until I feel useless. It’s like the spark is gone, and that really hurts to admit.

Lately it feels like the years are on fast-forward. I catch myself noticing new gray hairs and my niece’s school photos jumping from kindergarten to middle school in what feels like a blink. I’m not trying to fix anything—I just wanted to say out loud that getting older feels both tender and a little scary.

I can’t stop gushing about indoor bouldering lately. The mix of problem-solving and that split-second of trust when you commit to a dynamic move is just electric. Chalky hands, pumping music, a gnarly V4 that finally clicks—nothing has made me feel stronger and more alive in ages.
Ugh, I tried to make a joke during the toast, no one laughed, and I felt the room swallow me. Now I'm lying here reliving it and wishing I could crawl into a hole.

We had a big fight and made up, but now every small thing they do irritates me, and then I feel awful about myself. I don't want to be the villain in my relationship, but I'm all mixed up. Not looking for fixes—just sharing how it feels.

Ever since I adopted my guinea pig during lockdown, the little squeaks when I open the fridge and the routine of morning veggies have been the anchor of my day. It's wild how much comfort such a small creature can bring.

It’s odd—songs I loved in college are now on “oldies” playlists, and somehow the weekend evaporates between Friday night and Sunday dishes. Aging used to be an abstract idea; now it’s the pace of everything speeding past me.
I lost my grandmother three months ago, and some days the grief just crashes over me out of nowhere. I don't need advice right now—I just wanted to say it out loud somewhere.
Hi! I don’t really have a question today; I just want to unwind and ramble for a few minutes.
Honestly, slipping into an RPG character is the one thing that calms my brain—I feel most like myself when I'm rolling dice and storytelling.
Honestly, I'm burned out. I've been working late nights and weekends for weeks, and even small tasks feel heavy now. I just wanted to vent to someone.
I’ve noticed that when I play role‑playing games, I relax and my social anxiety quiets down; it’s like the character gives me permission to be me.
I think I’m burned out. I’ve been pushing so hard for so long that even small tasks feel heavy, and I just needed to say that out loud.
Seeing the prime-time pundit downplay vaccine safety again after all the debunking made my blood boil. It's exhausting watching misinformation get a megaphone while people suffer the consequences.
I just watched the bodycam footage they released from last night's police shooting, and I'm shaken and angry. The way the report tries to gloss over what happened makes my stomach turn.

Random musing: I swear time used to stretch like summer afternoons, and now whole months vanish between laundry days. Birthdays sneak up on me and I feel like I’m constantly playing catch-up with my own life.
Mind if I just say this here? I had a great day and I'm really proud of myself.
Not looking for solutions—just wanted to share that I’ve been feeling isolated these past few weeks.
I'm feeling proud—I kept my promise to myself and meditated every morning this week.

I've been with my partner for three years, and they're kind and supportive, but lately I feel detached and guilty for not feeling that spark. I can't tell if it's a phase or if I'm outgrowing us. Just needed to say this somewhere.

Just need to say this out loud: I went to a networking mixer and forgot the person's name right after they said it, so I avoided using it all night and probably came off super weird. Feeling mortified.
Camping away from the streetlights, I lay there counting satellites and the quiet made the universe feel endless. It made me feel so small, but in a connected kind of way.

Not looking for advice—just sharing: my elderly cat has this habit of sleeping on my pillow whenever I’m anxious, and the rhythm of her purrs is the only thing that settles me. She’s like a tiny living weighted blanket.
I feel stuck in cringe mode after a friend's game night—talked over someone by accident, then over-explained my board game strategy to make up for it. My brain won't drop it.
I’m feeling guilty for not doing more, but honestly I’m exhausted. It’s like I’ve hit a wall and I’m scared that pushing harder will just make it worse.
Permission to humblebrag for a second? Today went so well and I'm proud of me.
I’m not looking for advice, just venting: I grew up worrying about bills and now that old panic is back. Even checking my bank app spikes my anxiety.
I’m feeling really homesick today. I miss my dad’s Sunday breakfasts and the way the house smells like coffee. Not looking for advice—just wanted to say it somewhere.

Painting tabletop miniatures has become my little zen world. Layering highlights, glazing shadows, and seeing a tiny character come to life under the brush is wildly satisfying. It’s meticulous, a bit meditative, and I’ve never felt so proud of a hobby before.

I had a terrible day and couldn't stop spiraling, but my dog, Milo, hopped onto the couch and pressed his head against my chest until I could breathe again. It blows my mind how safe and steady he makes me feel.
My wedding is this Saturday and I’m equal parts giddy and jittery—I just needed to put that somewhere.
I feel like every dollar is already spoken for before I even get paid. It’s exhausting and I can’t stop thinking about it.
Even on good days, evenings feel heavy since my friend died. I'm trying to carry on, but the ache keeps returning like a tide.
I used to have energy and drive, and now I’m just… flat. Breaks feel like failure and grinding feels impossible. I think I’m burned out and I’m tired of forcing it.

Got into it with my best friend because I missed their messages during a busy week, and they said I don’t make time for people. I got defensive and said some snippy things, and now I’m rattled and guilty. I don’t want a pep talk or advice—just needed to say it out loud somewhere.
I leave for Kyoto in two weeks and I can't stop picturing temple gardens and steaming bowls of ramen—I'm practically vibrating with excitement over here.
I’m okay, just tired of feeling like I’m on my own all the time and wanted to get that off my chest.

I'm livid after reading that story about our city officials steering disaster relief funds to their buddies' contracts while families are still living in motels. It feels like pure betrayal, and I'm disgusted that they keep calling it 'standard procurement.'
Honestly, I'm burned out on social media—too many opinions, not enough connection. Not looking for advice, just sharing how I feel.
Guess what—today was awesome, and I'm feeling proud of myself; can I just celebrate that here?
My brain is already on the Amalfi Coast even though I'm still at my desk; all I can daydream about is lemon groves, cliffside buses, and sea air—I'm so giddy I can’t focus.

Had a fight with my dad about moving out, and he threw “after everything I’ve done for you” at me. It hit me like a punch and now I’m teary and shaky, like I’m a kid again. I’m just going to spill this here because I don’t want to drag my friends into it. Thanks for letting me unload for a second.

I’m feeling really thankful for the small, tender moments today. A child’s chalk drawings on the sidewalk, a forgotten note tucked in my jacket pocket, my cat choosing my lap over the windowsill, and the smell of rain on warm pavement. They stitched the day together in a quiet way, and I wanted to savor that.
Hey, small win update: I had a genuinely good day and showed up for myself—okay to share that I'm proud?
Not looking for advice right now—just venting: my creativity feels totally blocked and it’s starting to be really discouraging.
RPG nights are my reset button. Being in a party and improvising makes me feel grounded and authentically me.

I think my favorite part of today was the ordinary magic: the first sip of tea, a red light turning green right when I needed it, a friend sending the exact meme to break my stress, and catching the moon framed between two buildings on my walk home. Small moments, big gratitude.
Lately it feels like I’m running on fumes—always sprinting, never arriving. I keep pushing, but the tank is empty and I’m tired of pretending it’s not.
I keep telling myself I’ll start tomorrow, but tomorrow keeps moving. I’m disappointed in myself and exhausted by the guilt that follows.
Every time I check Instagram or Twitter, I end up anxious and irritated. I'm over the comparisons and hot takes—just needed to say that out loud.

I turned another year older last week, and the calendar flip hit me harder than I expected. There’s this bittersweet mix of gratitude and grief, like I’m collecting moments faster than I can really live them.

My sister and I blew up over holiday plans—she called me selfish, I told her she’s controlling, and we both hung up. I’m sitting in my car with my hands trembling and my stomach in knots. Conflict makes me feel physically sick and I hate it. I don’t need solutions; I just need to vent to someone.

I'm completely wiped out from work lately. Every day feels like a blur of meetings and deadlines, and I don't have anything left in the tank by the time I log off. I don't need advice—just needed to say it.
Honestly, I'm proud of myself for cooking at home five nights in a row instead of ordering takeout—this is a big change for me.
I feel overwhelmed and drained. The emails, the pings, the ‘urgent’ tasks that never end—it's like I can't catch my breath and it's wearing me down.

Today I got one of those gentle, ordinary-good days. A warm cup of coffee that somehow tasted perfect, a neighbor’s wave across the street, a sunbeam on the kitchen floor, and a favorite song popping up on the radio. Even the bus driver cracked a goofy joke. Just feeling grateful for these tiny things that made me smile.
Money stress is sitting on my chest lately—rent, loans, unexpected stuff. I’m overwhelmed and it’s making me snappy with people.
I spent another evening scrolling instead of studying, and now the guilt is heavy. It feels like I'm stuck in a loop of avoidance and self-criticism.

Gardening has me completely in my feelings right now. Watching tiny seedlings push through soil and turn into something lush and alive is magic—like, honest-to-goodness everyday wonder. Dirt under my nails, a warm evening breeze, the first tomato blush… I’m smitten.
On my walk tonight the Milky Way looked like a soft river overhead and I suddenly felt small and calm at the same time. It’s wild how the night can make life feel fragile and okay all at once.
I used to love making things, but lately everything I try feels forced and flat. It’s frustrating and kind of demoralizing.
I keep thinking I'm over it and then a song or a smell brings everything back. I'm tired and tender and miss him so much.
Big marathon day in 48 hours—can’t sleep because I’m buzzing and nervous at the same time. Thanks for letting me vent.
Today the sadness hit hard in the grocery store when I saw her favorite cereal. I felt fine, then suddenly I wasn't. It's exhausting riding these waves.
I'm cringing so hard about last night's birthday dinner. I waved at someone who wasn't waving at me, then spilled salsa on my shirt, and I keep replaying it like a blooper reel.
Just venting: social media has started to feel draining and performative to me. I'm tired of the endless scrolling and I'm kind of over it.
When I’m in a D&D or Persona session, I finally exhale—role‑playing lets me drop the mask and just be who I am.

That news update about the oil company paying a slap-on-the-wrist fine after the spill has me fuming. Beaches ruined, fishermen out of work, and their PR team just says 'lessons learned'—it's insulting.

We're long-distance and I get anxious when they don't text back, but when we finally talk I feel oddly distant. It feels like I miss the idea of us more than the reality, and I'm ashamed of that. Putting this here because I needed to get it off my chest.
I present to the whole company tomorrow. Super excited to finally share my work, but my stomach is doing backflips.
It’s grey and rainy and it reminded me of home so much that my chest aches. I just miss my people.
Hello there. Kind of bored and wanted some light conversation—nothing specific on my mind, just hanging out.
Small win: I've cut my screen time in half for two weeks straight, and it feels great to be sticking with it.
I finally booked that solo hiking trip in Patagonia, and just thinking about the trails and big skies makes my chest feel light; it’s such a needed escape.
Hey, just felt like being social for a moment. Thought I’d pop in and say hello and see where the conversation goes.

I just had a nasty argument with my partner about money. They said I “never listen” and I snapped back, and now the apartment is quiet and I’m literally shaking. I feel small and defensive at the same time, like I messed up but also like I wasn’t being heard. I’m not looking for advice, just needed to put this somewhere.
Got accepted to grad school abroad! I’m thrilled, but now the reality is hitting and I’m kind of scared too.
val_prompts: Grief has been heavy since my grandpa passed, but my goofy mutt keeps dropping his favorite toy in my lap and doing that ridiculous wiggle until I smile. I just needed to say how grateful I am for him.

I am absolutely obsessed with baking sourdough right now—like, full-on nerding out about hydration percentages, stretch-and-folds, and the way the house smells when that crust crackles out of the oven. I can’t get over the little alchemy of flour, water, salt, and time; it’s become my happy ritual and I’m loving every second of it.

I keep swinging between wanting to build a future together and wanting to be completely alone for a while. It makes me feel flaky and unfair to them. I don't even know if what I'm feeling is love, fear, or just boredom—just venting.
Hey! Just dropping in to say hi—I’m in a chatty mood and don’t have any agenda, just felt like talking a bit.
The city sky finally cleared and I found Orion next to a thin crescent moon. Standing under all that makes me feel like a speck—and somehow that’s comforting.
Is it weird that opening my feeds leaves me exhausted and empty? I used to enjoy it, but now it all feels like noise and I'm done.
Sitting in front of my sketchbook for an hour and drawing nothing felt awful today. Ugh, I hate feeling like this.
I'm feeling guilty because I've been procrastinating on a big report for days and keep finding small distractions instead. Just needed to say that out loud.
I’ve been feeling really lonely lately and just needed to say it out loud to someone.
Today hit me harder than usual; the quiet makes me feel invisible and alone, and I needed to tell someone.
I hate that money has this much power over my mood. It’s always humming in the background, and I’m tired of carrying it alone.
I’m counting down sleeps until my bestie trip to New Orleans—jazz spilling into the streets, beignets, late-night strolls—can’t wipe this goofy grin off my face.
Just wanted to share: I've gone 21 days without smoking, and I'm really proud of how far I've come.
Work has been swallowing me whole. I'm exhausted, irritable, and starting to dread opening my laptop each morning. Needed to get that off my chest.
Kind of embarrassed to admit it, but I’m struggling with homesickness today—songs, food, even random street smells are setting me off. Needed to get that off my chest.
I just stood outside staring at the stars for a while and felt tiny in the best way, like my worries dissolved into the dark sky. Just needed to share that.

10.summary:
Category: Technical Help (e.g. Mathematical Calculation, Data Analysis, Computer Programming)
Intent: Doing (Requesting ChatGPT to perform a task, generating output that is directly used for a task.)
train_prompts: Using plain HTML/CSS, how do I center a button both horizontally and vertically on the page and make it responsive (min-height 44px, padding, scales with text)? Please provide a self-contained snippet.
In Google Sheets, I have test scores in B2:B, and I want 'Pass' if the score is 70 or higher, otherwise 'Fail'. Leave the cell blank if B is blank. What formula should I put in C2 and copy down?

Can you write a SQL Server query for this schema?
- OrderHeader(OrderID int, OrderDate datetime2, Status nvarchar(20))
- OrderLine(OrderID int, ProductID int, Qty int, UnitPrice decimal(12,2))
- Product(ProductID int, ProductName nvarchar(200))
I need the top 10 products by revenue for the current month (based on server local time), ignoring orders with Status in ('Canceled','Refunded'). Output ProductID, ProductName, and Revenue, sorted descending.
How can I generate a deduplicated list of email domains from A2:A200 with a single Excel 365 formula? I just want the part after @ for each email, converted to lowercase.
Using the exclusive method (Tukey's), what's the median, Q1, and Q3 for this dataset: 5, 2, 9, 4, 4, 7, 1, 6?

I need an HTML input pattern to validate US phone numbers in these formats only: 212-555-7890, (212) 555-7890, and 2125557890. No country code, no extension. Please provide the regex pattern attribute value.
In Spring with Quartz, what's the correct cron expression to trigger at 6:00 PM on weekdays only?
If I invest $2,750 at 6% with continuous compounding for 3.5 years, what's the final amount and how much interest is that?
Please convert the following from miles to kilometers and show each pair as 'X mi -> Y km' with 3 significant figures: 0.1; 2; 8.25; 50; 100.

PostgreSQL: Given customer(cust_id bigint, full_name text) and purchase(purchase_id bigint, cust_id bigint, created_at timestamp), how do I count purchases per customer over the last 30 days? Return cust_id and purchase_count. Please include customers with no purchases as 0.
I have monthly returns: -0.5%, 1.2%, 0.0%, 2.3%, -1.0%, 3.1%. What's the geometric average monthly growth rate across these months?

I have a tiny Python app with two files in the repo root: app.py and requirements.txt. Can you write a minimal Dockerfile using python:3.11-slim that installs from requirements.txt and runs python app.py, and also show the docker build and docker run commands?

How can I split names in Excel when some cells have only a single name? Example data in A2:A6: "Prince", "Grace Hopper", "Beyoncé", "Alan M. Turing". I want a formula for B2 (first) and C2 (last) that trims extra spaces and leaves C2 blank if there's no last name. I'm on Microsoft 365.

Please compute the future value for P = $8,200, annual rate = 3.2%, compounded semiannually for 9 years, and also report the total interest. Use the standard compound interest formula and round to two decimals.

In R with dplyr: I have a data frame df with columns txn_date (Date in YYYY-MM-DD), store_id (character), and sales (numeric). Can you show a snippet to filter rows between '2024-04-01' and '2024-06-30' inclusive and return total sales per store_id?

I'm getting ModuleNotFoundError inside my container. Could you write a Dockerfile that sets PYTHONPATH=/app, installs dependencies from requirements.txt, creates and uses a non-root user, and starts the app with python main.py? My files (main.py, requirements.txt) are in the project root.
I don't want to use pandas. Can you show a minimal Python script using the csv module to load input.csv, drop rows that have any empty fields, and save to output.csv?

I need to POST a new order via curl to my REST API endpoint https://orders.acme.io/api/orders. The API requires X-API-Key: pk_live_abc123 and Accept: application/json headers. The JSON payload should be {"sku":"WIDG-1","qty":3,"expedite":true}. What would the curl look like?

In JavaScript, what regex (with flags) should I use with matchAll to extract email addresses from free-form text? Please keep it reasonably permissive but avoid obvious false positives. Test string:

Emails: bob@example.com; 'John Smith' <john.smith@example.io>; bad: a..b@ex..ample.com

I’ve got score in C2 and attendance percentage in D2. A student passes only if C2>=65 and D2>=0.8; otherwise Fail. Could you give me a single formula for E2 that returns Pass/Fail and also handles blanks (i.e., returns empty string if both C2 and D2 are empty)?
Using the newer git switch syntax, how do I create a branch named bugfix/null-check and push it to origin, setting the upstream tracking branch?

I have a tibble events with date_time (POSIXct), team (factor), and points (integer). What’s the R code to keep only rows that occurred on 2025-01-15 (any time that day) and then sum points by team using dplyr?

Write a short R snippet (dplyr) for a data frame invoices with columns invoice_date (Date), customer_id (character), product_code (character), and amount (numeric). Filter invoice_date >= '2023-07-01' and < '2023-10-01', then return total amount grouped by customer_id and product_code.
Could you compute the average monthly growth rate (simple average) for these monthly changes: +2.4%, -1.1%, +0.8%, +3.0%, +1.5%? Please show the short calculation.
From Jan to Jun the percentage changes were: 1.8%, 2.2%, -0.9%, 0.7%, 1.1%, 2.5%. What is the average monthly growth rate? Round to two decimals.

Can you give me a short Python (pandas) script that reads data.csv, removes any rows with missing values in any column, and writes the result to cleaned.csv? Assume missing values might be empty strings or 'NA'.
In Java, what's a clean way to implement a static method that reverses a String while avoiding NullPointerException? I'd like a drop-in method with a quick explanation of the null behavior.

I have a CSV file called data.csv with columns date and temp. Can you write matplotlib code (using pandas to read the file) to plot temp as a line versus date, with axis labels and slightly rotated x tick labels?

I’m using Python re. What’s a concise pattern for re.fullmatch that validates a 10-digit US phone number with optional country code +1 and optional separators (space, dash, dot) and optional parentheses around the area code? A single regex is fine.
Using 1 mile = 1.60934 km, return just a JSON array of the kilometer values for [0, 0.2, 1.8, 4, 15.5].
How can I export a list of all services and their current status to C:\Temp\Services.csv using PowerShell?

I'm stuck on Excel 2013. I need a formula to split first and last names from A2 when some entries have middle names or initials. I just want the first word as the first name and the last word as the last name. Can you give me the two formulas (for B2 and C2) using only classic functions like LEFT, RIGHT, SEARCH, and LEN?

Project layout:

.
├── requirements.txt
└── src
    └── main.py

Please provide a simple Dockerfile that sets WORKDIR /app, copies requirements.txt first for build caching, installs dependencies, copies the rest of the code, exposes port 8080, and runs python -m src.main.
I need a small Java utility function to reverse a string that safely handles null input by returning an empty string. Can you provide the code?

In Excel 365, column A has full names like "Ada Lovelace", sometimes with extra spaces. What formula should I put in B2 for the first name and in C2 for the last name? Please use TEXTBEFORE/TEXTAFTER and TRIM. Data starts in A2.
In pandas, what's a one-liner to group my DataFrame by the 'category' column and sum the 'amount' column?

I have full names in A2 that may include middle names, e.g., "Juan Carlos de la Cruz". I want a formula where first name = the first word only, and last name = everything after the first space (so "Carlos de la Cruz" in this example). What's the best formula for B2 and C2 on Excel 365?
On a remote computer named FILESRV01, how do I get a list of services with their status via PowerShell?

Can you give me a curl command that POSTs JSON to https://api.mystore.com/v1/users? I need to send this body: {"name":"Ava","email":"ava@example.com"} and include headers Content-Type: application/json and Authorization: Bearer TOKEN123. Just the one-line command, please.

PostgreSQL help: tables are sales(sale_id serial, product_id int, qty int, price numeric(10,2), sold_at timestamptz, canceled boolean default false) and products(product_id int primary key, title text). I need a query that lists the top 10 products by revenue for the current calendar month in America/New_York time, excluding rows where canceled = true. Please return product_id, title, total_revenue, and total_qty.
Convert these mile distances to kilometers, rounding to two decimals: 3.1, 7.5, 12, 0.25, 26.2.
Quick calc: For $15,000 over 5 years, how much will I have with 4.8% APR compounded monthly vs 4.9% APR compounded quarterly? Which option yields more?
Could you compute the compound interest on $10,000 at 5% APR compounded annually for 7 years? Please give the ending balance and the total interest earned, rounded to the nearest cent.
Given df = pd.DataFrame({'category':['A','A','B',None],'amount':[5,7,3,4]}), can you give a pandas one-liner to sum amounts per non-null category and sort the totals descending?

Show a curl example that reads JSON from a file and POSTs it: endpoint https://api.example.com/v2/projects?region=eu, headers Content-Type: application/json, X-Client: demo, Authorization: Bearer abcdef123. The file name is project.json. Keep it to a single command.
From tag v2.3.1, how can I create a new branch hotfix/v2.3.2 and push it to origin with the upstream set?
What Excel formula can I use to extract the domain part of an email in cell A2 (everything after the @)? Example: 'alice.smith@contoso.co.uk' should return 'contoso.co.uk'.
I’m on Ubuntu. What’s a safe bash one-liner to recursively find empty directories under /var/log/myapp and delete them, with a dry-run preview first?

Give me a tiny HTML/CSS example of a centered responsive button labeled "Sign Up" that fills the width on mobile (<480px) and is 240px wide and centered on larger screens. No frameworks; include both HTML and CSS.
I need a link styled as a button centered in its parent div; it should be responsive and not exceed 320px, but be 100% width on small screens. Can you show a minimal snippet using flexbox?
I have /data with many nested dirs. Provide a bash one-liner to remove empty directories only within depth 3, and output the names as they’re removed.
What Git commands should I run to create a new branch called feature/login from my current branch and push it to origin with the upstream set?
I have a pandas DataFrame df with columns 'Year' and 'Sales'. Can you provide code to plot Sales vs Year as a line chart with a grid and save it to 'sales.png'? Please just provide the code.
I’m stuck on Excel 2016 (no TEXTAFTER). What formula using FIND/SEARCH and MID will pull the domain from the email in B2?

I need a pandas one-liner that outputs a two-column DataFrame with columns ['category','total_amount'] where total_amount is the sum of 'amount' per 'category' (no category as index). What should I write?

On Windows PowerShell, how do I POST JSON with curl to https://api.myapp.io/v1/tickets using this body: {"subject":"Login issue","priority":"high"} and header X-API-Token: 9f8e7d? Please ensure the quoting works in PowerShell.

I'm using grep -E. What's a POSIX ERE regex that matches email addresses in logs but skips hosts without a dot (e.g., user@localhost)? Sample lines:

2025-01-02 INFO user signed up: alice@example.com
WARN invalid email: bob@@example..com
Note: temp sender user@localhost
Forward to support@helpdesk.example.org.
Please calculate both the arithmetic mean and the compounded (geometric) average of these monthly percentage changes: 0.6%, 1.4%, 2.0%, -0.8%, 1.1%.
From the current directory, how can I delete all empty folders except those named .git or node_modules using a one-liner?

Please write a Google Sheets formula for F2 that calculates a weighted score from C2 (quizzes 20%), D2 (midterm 30%), and E2 (final 50%), and then returns Pass if the weighted score is at least 70, otherwise Fail. Treat any missing component as 0.
For this small data set with negatives, please give the median, Q1, and Q3 (use the inclusive method like Excel’s QUARTILE.INC): -3, 0, -1, 4, 2, -2, 5, 1, 3.
For a Kubernetes CronJob, what should spec.schedule be to run Monday through Friday at 6pm? Assume the cluster uses its default timezone.

Can you give me a regex for Python re that extracts all email addresses from a block of text (supporting plus tags like jane+news@example.com and subdomains), and ignores trailing punctuation like commas or periods? Sample text:

Contact us at sales@example.com, jane.doe+vip@sub.mail.example.co.uk. Or DM @someone.
What’s the exact crontab line to run /usr/local/bin/backup.sh every weekday (Mon–Fri) at 6:00 PM? Please include the command in the line.
I’m on main—what’s the shortest sequence of commands to create release/1.4.0 from main and push it to origin so future git push works without extra flags?

For a small FastAPI app (ASGI path: app.main:app) with a requirements.txt, can you write a simple Dockerfile using python:3.12-slim that installs requirements and starts uvicorn on port 8000? Please include example docker build and run commands.
Find the median, first quartile (Q1), and third quartile (Q3) of these numbers: 12, 7, 3, 9, 10, 14, 8, 6, 11.

Can you give me a JavaScript-compatible regex to validate simple US phone numbers? Accept: 4155551234, 415-555-1234, 415.555.1234, 415 555 1234, (415) 555-1234, and optionally a leading +1 or 1 with or without a space. Use start/end anchors and don’t match letters.
On macOS, give me a single find command to delete empty directories inside ~/Downloads, including dot-directories, but not removing ~/Downloads itself.
Could you compute the median, Q1, and Q3 for these values and show the sorted order you used: 23.5, 17.2, 19.8, 21.0, 18.4, 22.7, 20.1?

In Excel 365, I’ve got emails in column A. Some cells have extra spaces and a few entries don’t have an “@”. Can you give me a single-cell formula for A2 that returns the domain in lowercase (text after @) and returns blank if no @ is found?

SQL Server help: Two tables—Users(UserID int, Email nvarchar(200)) and Orders(OrderID int, UserID int). I need a query that lists the top 10 users by total order count (highest first). Exclude users with zero orders.
I just need the standard cron expression for 'every weekday at 18:00'. What is it?

Using data.table, I’ve got orders with columns order_date (Date), region (character), and value (numeric). How do I filter to the last 90 days relative to Sys.Date() and compute the sum of value by region?

In MySQL, I have tables customers(id INT, name VARCHAR(100)) and orders(order_id INT, customer_id INT, status VARCHAR(20), order_date DATE). Write a query that returns each customer's id and name with the count of their orders in 2025, excluding rows where status = 'canceled'. Include customers with zero orders.
In .NET (C#), what regex would you recommend to match +1 (303) 555-0100, 303-555-0100, 303.555.0100, and 3035550100, but not 123-45-678 or 555-010? Keep it simple and anchored.
Can you write a small snippet that centers a "Buy Now" button under a product image, keeps it responsive (max-width 280px, width: 100%), and uses CSS only (no JS)? Include HTML structure and CSS.
val_prompts: Can you write a small command-line Python script that takes an input CSV path and an output path, drops rows with NaN/null/blank cells, and preserves the header? Show how to run it.
I have these distances in miles: 0.5, 1, 2.3, 5.5, 10, 13.1. Convert to kilometers and give me a comma-separated list, rounded to one decimal place.
PowerShell one-liner to show only running services, displaying Name and Status, sorted by Name?
Create a Java method that reverses characters in a String using StringBuilder. It must be null-safe (no exceptions). Please show the method signature and body only.

I only want to extract company emails from acme.com (including subdomains like team.acme.com). What regex would do that over a multiline string? Example:

Reach us at help@acme.com,
sales@team.acme.com,
and partners@other.com.

SQLite: Tables customer(id INTEGER, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT) and order_header(order_id INTEGER, customer_id INTEGER, status TEXT). Write a query to return id and order_count per customer, counting only status IN ('paid','shipped'), and ensure customers with no matching orders show 0.
Using pandas, how do I in a single expression group by 'category' and sum 'amount', keeping only groups with total > 10?

SQLite query request. Tables:
- sales(id integer primary key, product_id int, quantity int, unit_price real, sold_on text ISO8601)
- products(id int primary key, name text)
Give me a query to get the top 10 products by sales amount for the current month, breaking ties by higher total quantity and then by name alphabetically.

I have course codes in A2:A and student scores in B2:B. The passing mark varies by course and is listed on a sheet named Lookup in A:B (column A = course code, column B = pass threshold). What formula can I put in C2 to return Pass if B2 meets the threshold for A2, else Fail?
Please write a Java method reverse(String s) that returns the reverse of s. If s is null, the method should return null instead of throwing. Keep it simple and include a brief example call.
Given these two lists: x = [0, 1, 2, 3, 4] and y = [3, 1, 4, 1, 5], show a minimal matplotlib snippet to plot a simple line with circle markers and a title 'Example'.

I’ve got NumPy arrays t = np.array([0, 2, 4, 6]) and v = np.array([0.0, 1.5, 3.0, 2.0]). How do I plot v over t as a line chart in matplotlib with x label 'Time (s)' and y label 'Velocity (m/s)' and then show it?

In MySQL, I have these tables:
- orders(id INT PK, order_date DATE, status VARCHAR(20))
- order_items(order_id INT, product_id INT, quantity INT, unit_price DECIMAL(10,2))
- products(id INT PK, name VARCHAR(255))
Please write a single SQL query to return the top 10 products by total sales amount for the current month (sum of quantity*unit_price), only for orders where status = 'paid'. Include product name and total_sales, ordered from highest to lowest.
What's the PowerShell command to list all Windows services with their Name, DisplayName, Status, and StartType?

How do I drop rows with missing values only if 'age' or 'email' is missing, but keep rows where other columns are missing? Please provide a Python snippet using pandas that reads users.csv and writes users_clean.csv.

12.summary:
Category: Writing (e.g. Edit or Critique User-Provided Text, Personal Writing or Communication, Translation, Argument or Summary Generation, Write Fiction)
Intent: Asking (Seeking information or advice for the user to be better informed on something. The user is asking for information, but the output of the model should serve to inform the user, not to be directly used for a task.)
train_prompts: What are the main paper-formatting differences between APA and MLA (e.g., title page, headings, running head, page numbers)?

As a Chinese–English bilingual translating for product UI and tech blogs, how do I decide when to keep source-side wording (e.g., 功能, 体验, 打造) versus using idiomatic English (“feature,” “user experience,” “build/create”)? Brief guidelines for tone and consistency, please.
For subtitles of comedy, what rules of thumb help preserve comedic timing and punchlines (e.g., line breaks, pacing, and minimal text)? Keep it to a few concrete tips.

Here are two lines I wrote in Spanish: “El mar golpea mi puerta / con puños de sal y luna.” Using this as an example, how would you approach choices to keep imagery vivid and the rhythm natural in English, and what pitfalls should I watch for?
When apologizing over email to a client for a missed deadline, how should I structure the message so it feels accountable and not defensive? Please outline the key parts and common pitfalls to avoid.
I'm working on improving 'show, don't tell.' How could I rewrite this telling line to show what's happening instead: 'John was furious at the meeting and everyone felt uncomfortable'?

Here are a few sentences from my draft. Identify the passive/wordy bits and suggest tighter rewrites: "The report was completed by the team in a timely manner. There are several factors that need to be taken into consideration. It is believed that the results could be improved." Keep the style neutral and professional.
Is it okay to use bullets or bold text in emails to my manager, and are emojis ever acceptable? I’m on a remote software team and want to keep messages clear but professional.
When should I use telling instead of showing? How do experienced writers decide where to show versus tell in a scene?

When translating free verse from Spanish to English, how can I preserve concrete imagery while still capturing the cadence of the original, especially when line breaks carry rhythm? Any rules of thumb for deciding when to keep a metaphor literal versus adapting it for flow?

How should I format and personalize a letter to my city council member about speeding on our street? What kind of evidence or attachments are most useful, and is it appropriate to mention upcoming elections?
In plain terms, what are the key differences between APA (7th ed.) and MLA (9th ed.) styles, especially for in‑text citations and the reference/works cited page?
Do you have a simple framework or checklist I can use to condense a long research report into a short summary without losing the main message? Tips for cutting jargon appreciated.
What are the most common mistakes professionals make when summarizing long reports, and how can I avoid them to keep my summary tight and accurate?
I'm writing an argument paper about campus parking. Can you explain how to build a strong thesis and organize the intro, body paragraphs, and conclusion so the logic flows?
What’s the best way to quantify achievements when I don’t have exact numbers? For example, I improved a process in our warehouse but we never tracked time saved.
For a 650-word Common App essay, how would you break down the outline—hook, context, turning point, reflection, and looking ahead—and roughly how much space should each part get?
What are the most common mistakes that make dialogue feel obviously written instead of spoken, and what quick checks can I use during revision to spot and fix them?
I need to summarize a detailed client compliance report for a 10-minute meeting with non-technical stakeholders. How should I prioritize data vs narrative so the takeaways are obvious and concise?

What's the best way to structure a strong LinkedIn About section? How long should it be, what tone works, and which specifics (metrics, keywords) matter most? I'm a mid-career product manager looking to move into climate tech.
I have 8 years in B2B sales. What are the most common mistakes people make in their LinkedIn About sections, and how can I make mine sound authentic and not salesy?
If I drastically change the wording but keep the same sentence structure and sequence of ideas from a paper, could that be considered plagiarism? How different should a good paraphrase be?

For a SaaS company, how would you structure a one-page executive summary for stakeholders about Q4 performance and an upcoming pricing change? What length, sections, and order work best to keep it concise but decision-oriented?
For a ~75,000-word mystery that reveals the culprit near the end, what’s a reasonable cadence for clue drops and mini-reveals per act, and how can I keep the middle from sagging?

Which phrases signal very formal English, and what casual alternatives could I use instead? For instance, what could replace 'I would like to inquire,' 'Please be advised,' and 'I look forward to your response.'
I tend to add too much background. What are the most common pitfalls to avoid in executive summaries, and do you have a short checklist I can use before sending to the board?
For a 5–7 page persuasive essay in first-year comp, what's a clear structure I can follow? Where should the counterargument and rebuttal go, and how many body sections make sense?
How can I use urgency and social proof ethically in a CTA without sounding pushy? When do phrases like “Start today” or “Join 10,000+ teams” help, and when should I avoid them?

I'm bilingual (English–Spanish). When should I choose a literal translation versus an idiomatic one across different genres (news, legal, marketing)? A few practical rules of thumb and common pitfalls would help.
Could you give a brief example showing how the same journal article would be cited in‑text and in the reference list in APA versus MLA?
How formal should I be when emailing my manager to admit a mistake and propose a fix? Any do’s and don’ts to keep it professional without sounding defensive?
In third-person fiction I overuse 'there is/are' openings and filter verbs like 'seemed' and 'felt.' What are a couple of go-to rewrites to make those lines more direct and vivid?

I struggle to turn broad topics into arguable, focused theses. Could you give me a simple process or heuristic (like 2–3 steps or questions) to move from a topic to a defensible claim, plus one common pitfall to avoid?
What makes a blog headline compelling without slipping into clickbait? Share a few practical do/don’t tips and one quick example headline.
Which headline is stronger for a decluttering post—"Tidy Up Your Life: 7 Surprising Decluttering Habits" or "Declutter Faster With These 7 Habits"—and why?
For a literary analysis draft, which aspects should I prioritize in my feedback (thesis, organization, analysis, style), and how can I balance critique with encouragement?
Could you explain what 'show, don't tell' means in fiction and give two short examples that illustrate the difference?

Here’s the CTA at the end of my webinar invite email: “Click here to learn more.” What’s weak about this, and how would you improve it for better clicks? Please suggest one or two stronger alternatives suited to a free, 45‑minute webinar.
I tend to come across as blunt in comments. Could you give me a few tactful sentence starters for noting an unclear thesis or weak evidence without discouraging my classmate?

I'm translating Spanish stand-up bits into English. How can I preserve the tone and humor—especially sarcasm and playful insults—without coming off as mean? A few practical guidelines and common pitfalls would help.
How should I tailor the same executive summary for investors versus internal department heads? Could you give one example sentence for each showing how to present the growth story?
I'm a freelance UX designer who sometimes job hunts and sometimes pitches clients. How should I adjust my LinkedIn About depending on whether I'm targeting recruiters vs. prospective clients?

I struggle to give characters distinct voices. What are some concise strategies to differentiate dialogue between a cynical detective in his 40s and an idealistic 20-something journalist, without leaning on caricature or heavy slang?

I’m translating a French sonnet written in alexandrines. What are practical strategies for balancing meter (e.g., switching to iambic pentameter) with preserving the poem’s core images and emotional tone, without the English sounding stilted?
What are the key elements of an effective letter to a member of Congress about a local transit project? Should I send it as an email or a physical letter, and how long is ideal?

What makes an apology feel sincere? I tend to over-explain and it comes across as defensive. Can you explain how to take responsibility and acknowledge impact without justifying, with a couple example sentences?

Which of these is a better thesis for a policy paper, and how could I tighten it to be more focused and arguable? A) "Governments should address climate change." B) "A revenue-neutral carbon tax is the most effective and politically viable tool for U.S. emissions reduction because it prices externalities and returns dividends to households."
I need to apologize to a friend I bailed on last minute. How do I say sorry without sounding defensive or making excuses? What are a few phrases I should use or avoid?

How can I make my dialogue sound natural without cluttering it with a lot of um’s and uh’s? What are a few practical techniques to balance realism with readability, especially around pauses, interruptions, and subtext?
I'm preparing a psychology literature review—should I use APA or MLA, and what features of the style make it the better fit?
What’s a simple A/B test I can run this week to improve my CTA copy on a pricing page? Suggest one variable to change and how to measure success.
What are some simple ways to show a character’s fear or anxiety without naming the emotion? A quick list of techniques and a short example sentence would help.
